DOC.brief_summary: To study the collection of blood from individuals known to be at high risk for HIV-infection or who have been recently infected with HIV. The data collected are used for diagnostic, prognostic and management decisions as outlined by current HIV-1 Treatment Guidelines.
DOC.brief_title: Viral and Host Factors in the Transmission and Pathogenesis of HIV
DOC.detailed_description: This phlebotomy protocol permits the collection of blood from individuals known to be at high risk for HIV-infection or who have been recently infected with HIV. Participants will have from 10 to 60 ml (approximately 1 to 4 tablespoons) of blood drawn for one or all of the following tests: - T cell subset enumeration - Serologic reactivity with HIV antigens - Viral load assays by bDNA, PCR, or RT-PCR - Routine Laboratory assessments (chemistries, liver function tests, hepatitis serology, RPR) - HIV-1 Resistance Testing These data are used for diagnostic, prognostic and management decisions as outlined by current HIV-1 Treatment Guidelines
DOC.criteria: recently infected with HIV1 HIV1 negative, and at high risk for infection
